headline: 1 Consumer Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Ignore
summary: Regarded as defensive investments, consumer staples stocks are generally safe bets in choppy markets. But they’re also double-edged swords as they often lag in booming conditions, and this pattern has persisted recently. Over the past six months, the industry has recorded a loss of 8.2%, a far cry from the S&P 500’s 14.4% ascent.
